questions.question: What will Allah use to recreate people after death?
options: A tiny bone at the base of the spine that never decays
Nothing, He creates them from scratch

questions.question: How will people emerge from their graves on Resurrection Day?
options: Barefoot, naked, and uncircumcised, just as they were first created

questions.question: According to Qur'an 70:43, how will people emerge from graves?
options: Rapidly as if hastening toward an erected idol

questions.question: What does resurrection prove about Allah?
options: His absolute power and promise of accountability

questions.question: Where will people stand near the front at the gathering?
options: Everyone stands in the same place

questions.question: What will the plain where people gather look like?
options: A vast, white, leveled plain stretching endlessly with no hiding places

questions.question: Who will find shade and relief on that Day?
options: Those who were rich in the world
Only those whom Allah grants mercy

questions.question: How will people be gathered on Judgment Day?
options: Barefoot and uncovered, in groups according to their deeds and beliefs

questions.question: According to Qur'an 70:4, how long will the Day of Standing be?
options: Fifty thousand years according to our time

questions.question: How close will the sun be above people's heads?
options: At the edge of the atmosphere

questions.question: What will happen to people's secrets on that Day?
options: Every secret thought, hidden action, and private deed will be exposed publicly

questions.question: How deeply will people sweat according to their sins?
options: Some ankle-deep, others knee-deep, waist-deep, or drowning completely

questions.question: How will the righteous receive their book of deeds?
options: In their right hand, causing them joy and relief

questions.question: What will be recorded in the book of deeds?
options: Only major sins and good deeds
Every single deed, word, and thought from their entire life

questions.question: How will the wicked receive their book?
options: In their left hand from behind their back

questions.question: Who recorded all our deeds throughout our lives?
options: The angels who watched us constantly

questions.question: What is the name of the scale where deeds will be weighed?
According to Qur'an 21:47, what weight will Allah bring forth for judgment?
options: Even the weight of a mustard seed

questions.question: What happens if someone's good and bad deeds are exactly equal?
options: They must wait one thousand years
Allah will decide their fate with His infinite mercy

questions.question: What will happen to even the tiniest good deed?
options: It will appear and have weight on the scale
It will be ignored as too small
It only counts if we remember it
It disappears if we did any sin

questions.question: Who will people approach first seeking intercession to begin judgment?
options: Adam, then Noah, then Abraham, then Moses, then Jesus

questions.question: What will Prophet Muhammad ﷺ say when asked to intercede?
options: He will refuse like the others
'I am the one for this' and will accept

questions.question: According to Qur'an 17:79, what station will Allah grant the Prophet ﷺ?
Where will the Prophet ﷺ prostrate to ask permission to intercede?
What are the qualities of Al-Kawthar's water?
options: Whiter than milk, sweeter than honey, more fragrant than musk

questions.question: Where does the water of Al-Kawthar come from?
options: Directly from the river in Paradise that Allah gave to the Prophet ﷺ

questions.question: Who will be prevented from drinking from Al-Kawthar?
options: Those who changed the religion or abandoned Islamic practices

questions.question: What happens after drinking from Al-Kawthar once?
options: You must drink again every hour

questions.question: How is the Sirāt bridge described?
options: Thinner than a hair and sharper than a sword

questions.question: What will guide believers across the Sirāt?
options: Light shining according to their good deeds

questions.question: According to Qur'an 19:71-72, what must everyone do?
options: Come to Hellfire, then Allah will save those who feared Him

questions.question: At what different speeds will people cross the Sirāt?
options: Like lightning, wind, horses, running, walking, or crawling
Everyone crosses at the same speed
Only two speeds: fast or slow

questions.question: What will happen when people see Hellfire displayed?
options: Believers will have hope and disbelievers will feel terror

questions.question: How hot will the flames of Hellfire feel even from far away?
options: So hot they can be felt from far away as it roars and breathes

questions.question: According to Qur'an 79:36, what will be brought forth for all to see?
Why will both destinations be displayed before crossing the bridge?
options: To make the reality of eternal consequences completely clear
To give people a final choice

questions.question: What are some names of Judgment Day mentioned in the Qur'an?
options: The Last Day and The Final Day

questions.question: What does the name 'Al-Qariah' mean?
According to Qur'an 56:1-2, what happens when the Event occurs?
options: People can prepare at that time
There is no denying its occurrence

questions.question: Why does the Day of Judgment have so many names?
options: Each name reveals different aspects of its terror and reality
To make it easier to remember
Different prophets gave it different names
The names are all the same in meaning

questions.question: Who will Allah permit to intercede on Judgment Day?
options: Righteous believers, angels, martyrs, scholars, and Qur'an memorizers

questions.question: What will children who died before puberty do for their parents?
options: Intercede for them, taking their hands and leading them into Paradise

questions.question: According to Qur'an 2:255, who can intercede with Allah?
options: No one except by His permission

questions.question: Who can benefit from intercession on Judgment Day?
options: Only believers who died with faith, not disbelievers

questions.question: How will Allah multiply good deeds on Judgment Day?
options: Not at all, they stay the same
By ten to seven hundred times or more

questions.question: What will Allah do with believers' sins that He concealed in the world?
options: Show them privately and then forgive them completely
Make them public for all to see

questions.question: According to Qur'an 7:56, who will Allah's mercy be near to?
How will believers enter Paradise?
options: Not by their deeds alone but by Allah's mercy overwhelming their shortcomings

questions.question: How much hotter is Hellfire compared to earthly fire?
What happens to the skin of people in Hellfire?
options: It burns once and they die
It is renewed constantly so they feel pain forever

questions.question: Who will receive the greatest punishment in Hellfire?
options: Those who associated partners with Allah, denied Him, or led others astray

questions.question: According to Qur'an 4:40, how much injustice does Allah do?
options: A little bit to test people
None to believers but some to disbelievers

questions.question: What flows through the gardens of Paradise?
options: Rivers of pure water, milk, honey, and wine that doesn't intoxicate

questions.question: What are the palaces in Paradise made of?
According to Qur'an 32:17, what has been hidden for believers in Paradise?
options: Comfort for eyes as reward that no soul knows

questions.question: What is the greatest pleasure in Paradise?
What will angels tell believers when they enter Paradise?
options: 'Peace be upon you; you have become pure, so enter it to abide eternally'

questions.question: How will believers be escorted to Paradise?
options: Angels will escort them to Paradise's gates which open wide

questions.question: According to Qur'an 39:73, how will the righteous be led to Paradise?
How will disbelievers be brought to Hellfire?
options: Dragged by harsh angels in chains and disgrace

questions.question: What will benefit us on Judgment Day when we stand alone before Allah?
options: Only our faith and righteous deeds

questions.question: How should knowing about Judgment Day change how we live?
options: It should make us afraid to do anything
We should pray sincerely, treat others kindly, avoid sins, and seek forgiveness
We should only think about it occasionally
We should ignore worldly life completely

questions.question: According to Qur'an 99:7-8, what will we see on Judgment Day?
options: Every atom's weight of good and evil we did

questions.question: What is the correct attitude of a wise believer?
options: Working hard doing good deeds while hoping for Allah's mercy
Relying only on deeds without hope
